Returns: A value that is calculated to be the linearly interpolated result, derived by separating the start and end values into separate color channels and interpolating each one separately, recombining the resulting values in the same way.
Parameters: float: The fraction from the starting to the ending values
Object: A 32-bit int value representing colors in the separate bytes of the parameter
Object: A 32-bit int value representing colors in the separate bytes of the parameter
evaluate(float,java.lang.Object,java.lan.Description: This function returns the calculated in-between value for a color given integers that represent the start and end values in the four bytes of the 32-bit int. Each channel is separately linearly interpolated and the resulting calculated values are recombined into the return value.
evaluate(float,java.lang.Object,java.lan.FullName: public Object evaluate (float fraction, Object startValue, Object endValue)

ClassDesc: This evaluator can be used to perform type interpolation between integer values that represent ARGB colors.
